intro: Wulfenia plantaginea, commonly known as the Sierra madre fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Wulfenia plantaginea is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes, contributing to local biodiversity.
